name: St. Cecilia
summary: Cecilia was a Roman noblewoman and Christian martyr who died in Rome. According to tradition, she was a consecrated virgin who converted her husband Valerian and his brother Tiburtius to Christianity. All three were martyred. She is said to have sung to God as she was being martyred, and she is the patron saint of musicians, singers, and church music. Her feast day is celebrated with great solemnity, and she is one of the most venerated virgin martyrs of the early Church.
